alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 3:00PM EST until January 09 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulation ranging from a coating to around an inch or two west of Keysers Ridge with 3 to 6 inches expected along and east of Keysers Ridge into western Allegany County including Savage Mountain. * WHERE...Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Snowfall rates around one to two inches per hour are possible during the morning commute on Interstate 68 from Keysers Ridge to Savage Mountain, increasing the potential for dangerous travelling conditions during this time. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as a wintry mix for most locations with a period of moderate to heavy snow most likely from Keysers Ridge to Savage Mountain. Precipitation will change to rain early Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
